item.description:
Yes, it’s time again for that annual winter tradition of the annual Slip, Stumble & Split – named after the popular alternative way to make it down a cross-country ski hill. Cross-country skiing experience is not required or even desired. Warm weather and ground conditions may cancel because, y’know, there won’t be snow. 

Trip’s Leaders: Koop & Stu Green

WHEN: Sunday, Jan. 15, 11 a.m.

WHERE: Weston Ski Track – site of the Leo J. Martin Golf Course, 200 Park Rd, Weston, MA.

EQUIPMENT: Warm clothes, skis (if you’ve got them), water.  

RSVP: To Koop at runnerkoop@aol.com or Stu at sagreen115@aol.com  before 9 PM on the 13th

COST: Ski trail pass: $15. Also, ski rentals/snowshoes are available for $13-18 plus a $5 charge for Meetups participants and guests which can be credited to a full Mosaic membership of $25.

FOR THE CURIOUS: http://www.skiboston.com/skitrack/skitrack.php. Call for latest conditions, call 781-891-6575.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Annual Slip, Stumble & Split: A Cross-Country Ski Experience.
